item.title: Our History
item.description: Hwa Nan Women’s College - Unique Social Experiment in South China Composed by Gordon M. Trimble (a Contributor and a descendant of the Trimble Family who funded Hwa Nan) November 29, 2023 At the beginning of the 20th Century, in an area larger and more populous than Great Britain began a social experiment than started a new tradition in South China that captured the imagination of women across the U.

item.title: About Us
item.description: Hwa Nan Women’s College in Fuzhou, China was founded by the Methodist Episcopal Church in US. It’s unique history, dating back to 1890 when Lydia Trimble started teaching girls in the villages of Fuzhou. When she discovered only Chinese boys received formal education, she devoted herself to the education of women for the next 50 years of her career. She established the first women’s college in southern China in 1908.

item.title: Contact
item.description: We are here to help you! Please feel free to contact us using the Contact Form below or email us directly at hwananalumnaeinc@gmail.com.

item.title: Donation
item.description: Educate the Women and You Change the World Women around the world continues to experience poverty, gender discrimination, employment and wage inequalities and most importantly lack of quality education. Please help us with your generous donations. How to Support Us? 1. Zelle hwananalumnaeinc@gmail.com 2. Venmo 626-378-5155 3. Check Hwa Nan Alumnae Inc. 529 Buttonwood Drive Brea, CA 92821 4.

item.title: Emporia State University

item.title: International Faculty Recruitment FAQ
item.description: International Faculty Recruitment - Frequently Asked Questions 1. How do I get a visa to come to Hwa Nan to teach? The first step is to complete and send the application for teaching along with a resume and copies of diplomas to Hwa Nan Women’s College. You can do this by e-mail which you will find at the end of this website. To be able to teach at Hwa Nan Women’s College, you have to apply for a work visa (Z visa).
